overview_of_class: This combined seminar-reporting class, offered each spring in Chicago, meets one full day per week for reporting and another day that is divided between reporting and a seminar. The class will focus on homeland security issues such as terrorism, port security, bioterrorism and pandemics, but also will include a basic understanding of the role of the military, intelligence and humanitarian law. Field trips to Chicago area preparedness offices as well as to Ft. Leavenworth and/or Ft. Riley are anticipated.
name: US Security & Civil Liberties Reporting
title: JOUR JOUR 422-0-20 US Security & Civil Liberties Reporting
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Only students in the MSJ program may enroll in these classes

The class will focus on homeland security issues such as terrorism, port security, bioterrorism and pandemics, but also will include a basic understanding of the role of the military, intelligence and humanitarian law. Field trips to Chicago area preparedness offices as well as to Ft. Leavenworth and/or Ft. Riley are anticipated.
